title: Ticket #1575: FiringReason() returns the wrong reason for a valid TimerRemove
description:
UserPolicy::FiringReason() doesn't return the correct reason when used with a ClassAd that has the ATTR_TIMER_REMOVE_CHECK attribute evaluate to true.

The unit test output: 

TEST:  Test that FiringReason() returns the correct reason after a call to AnalyzePolicy() with the PERIODIC_ONLY mode and a ClassAd that has TimerRemove evaluate to true.
INPUT:
    ClassAd:  [ PeriodicRemove = true; PeriodicHold = true; JobStatus = 2; PeriodicRelease = true; TimerRemove = 0; OnExitRemove = true; OnExitHold = true; CurrentTime = time() ]
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  The job attribute TimerRemove expression '0' evaluated to TRUE
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  The UNKNOWN (never set) TimerRemove expression '' evaluated to TRUE
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 2421 (0 seconds)
check_ins: 2010-Aug-12 11:32   Check-in [18785]: Added a firing source for when TimerRemove evaluates to true in UserPolicy::AnalyzePolicy(). (#1575) (By Josh Slauson )
